Description: Panel; ivory; carved in relief with a depiction of The Baptism: young Christ standing full-face up to waist in water; to left, St John the Baptist stands leaning forward upon a rock, one hand resting upon Christ's head; above, the hand of God with rays of light, and issuing from it the dove holding a shallow bowl in its beak; in the background, to right, an angel holding a garment(?) in the foreground reclines a draped and bearded figure (the River Jordan) crowned with reeds and right hand raised; trees in the upper part; raised border at top and bottom.
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1901 / Catalogue of Early Christian Antiquities and Objects from the Christian East in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (294)

Dalton 1909 / Catalogue of the Ivory Carvings of the Christian Era with Examples of Mohammedan Art and Carvings in Bone in the Department of British and Mediaeval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (10)

Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012-2013 11 Nov-25 Aug, USA, Art Institute of Chicago, Tradition Transformed: Late Roman and Early Byzantine Treasures from the British Museum
Condition: The panel is imperfect on both sides; a circular perforation to left of hand of God.
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Baptist (Prodromos)
